column2: Apple pulls New York Times apps in China after government request BEIJING Apple Inc  has removed the New York Times Co's  English- and Chinese-language news apps from its iTunes store in China following a request from the local authorities
column3: the companies said separately on Thursday. | Video  ~Apple's App Store generated $20 billion for developers in 2016 Apple Inc  said on Thursday its App Store generated $20 billion for developers in 2016
column5: helped by the popularity of games such as Pokemon Go and Super Mario Run and increased revenue from subscriptions. ~India reluctant to give special tax incentives to Apple India is resisting tech giant Apple Inc's  demand for tax incentives to make iPhones in the country
column6: with the trade minister saying on Thursday that the government may not make exceptions for the U.S. company. ~

column2: Exclusive: BRF sees $1.5 billion Halal unit IPO by late March - sources SAO PAULO Brazilian food exporter BRF SA is seeking to raise about $1.5 billion from the sale of a 20 percent stake of a unit focused on the halal processed food market via an initial public offering
column3: two people with direct knowledge of the plan said on Thursday. ~

column2: GM's China vehicle sales rise 7.1 percent year-on-year in 2016 BEIJING General Motors Co  and its joint venture partners sold 3.87 million vehicles in China in 2016
column3: up 7.1 percent from the previous year
column4: cementing the country's position as the U.S. automaker's top market for a fifth consecutive year. ~

column3: Kohl's slash 2016 profit forecasts citing weak holiday sales Department store chains Macy's Inc  and Kohl's Corp  both cut their 2016 profit forecasts on Wednesday
column4: after holiday season sales fell more than expected
column5: pushing down shares in the retail sector in extended trading. ~Sears' Craftsman deal deflects focus from dismal holiday sales Sears Holdings Corp  said it would sell its Craftsman tools business to Stanley Black & Decker Inc  for $900 million
column6: sending its shares up and taking some of the focus away from the company's dismal holiday season performance. ~
